com.amplifyframework.rx

Interface RxGraphQlBehavior

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    RxApiCategoryBehavior

    public interface RxGraphQlBehavior
    An Rx-idiomatic expression of Amplify's GraphQLBehavior.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • query

        <R> <any> query(GraphQLRequest<R> graphQlRequest)
        Query a remote API for a list objects. This is the most flexible version of query method available in the RxGraphQlBehavior, in that it accepts a primitive GraphQLRequest, directly. This method assumes that the `amplifyconfiguration.json` contains a single GraphQL API, configured during the call to RxAmplify.configure(Context). If not, this method emits an ApiException via the returned Single's error callback.
        Type Parameters:
        R - The type of object being queried
        Parameters:
        graphQlRequest - A raw GraphQL query request
        Returns:
        A cold Single which emits a GraphQLResponse on success, or an ApiException on failure to obtain a response. On success, the GraphQLResponse will contain a list of objects that meet the criteria in the provided GraphQLRequest. The response object may itself contain errors that were communicated by the endpoint; these may be inspected with GraphQLResponse.hasErrors() and GraphQLResponse.getErrors(). The network operation does not begin until the Single is subscribed. The operation may be terminated by invoking Disposable#dispose() on the Single subscription.

      • query

        <T> <any> query(java.lang.String apiName,
                GraphQLRequest<T> graphQlRequest)
        Query a remote API for a list objects. This is the most flexible version of query method available in the RxGraphQlBehavior, in that it accepts a primitive GraphQLRequest, directly.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of object being queried
        Parameters:
        apiName - The name of any GraphQL endpoint for which a configuration exists in the `amplifyconfiguration.json` that was used during the call to RxAmplify.configure(Context).
        graphQlRequest - A raw GraphQL query request
        Returns:
        A cold Single which emits a GraphQLResponse on success, or an ApiException on failure to obtain a response. On success, the GraphQLResponse will contain a list of objects that meet the criteria in the provided GraphQLRequest. The response object may itself contain errors that were communicated by the endpoint; these may be inspected with GraphQLResponse.hasErrors() and GraphQLResponse.getErrors(). The network operation does not begin until the Single is subscribed. The operation may be terminated by invoking Disposable#dispose() on the Single subscription.

      • mutate

        <T> <any> mutate(GraphQLRequest<T> graphQlRequest)
        Perform a mutation on a remote object using a raw GraphQLRequest. Along with mutate(String, GraphQLRequest), this is the most flexible of the mutation methods, since it allows direct specification of a raw GraphQLRequest. This method assumes that the `amplifyconfiguration.json` contains a single GraphQL API, configured during the call to RxAmplify.configure(Context). If not, this method emits an ApiException via the returned Single's error callback.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of object being mutated
        Parameters:
        graphQlRequest - A mutation request
        Returns:
        A cold Single which emits a GraphQLResponse on success, or an ApiException on failure to obtain a response. On success, the GraphQLResponse will contain the endpoint's understanding of the object, after the mutation. The response object may itself contain errors that were communicated by the endpoint; these may be inspected with GraphQLResponse.hasErrors() and GraphQLResponse.getErrors(). The network operation does not begin until the Single is subscribed. The operation may be terminated by invoking Disposable#dispose() on the Single subscription.

      • mutate

        <T> <any> mutate(java.lang.String apiName,
                 GraphQLRequest<T> graphQlRequest)
        Perform a mutation on a remote object using a raw GraphQLRequest. Along with mutate(GraphQLRequest), this is the most flexible of the mutation methods, since it allows direct specification of a raw GraphQLRequest.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of object being mutated
        Parameters:
        apiName - The name of any GraphQL endpoint for which a configuration exists in the `amplifyconfiguration.json` that was used during the call to RxAmplify.configure(Context).
        graphQlRequest - A mutation request
        Returns:
        A cold Single which emits a GraphQLResponse on success, or an ApiException on failure to obtain a response. On success, the GraphQLResponse will contain the endpoint's understanding of the object, after the mutation. The response object may itself contain errors that were communicated by the endpoint; these may be inspected with GraphQLResponse.hasErrors() and GraphQLResponse.getErrors(). The network operation does not begin until the Single is subscribed. The operation may be terminated by invoking Disposable#dispose() on the Single subscription.

      • subscribe

        <T> RxOperations.RxSubscriptionOperation<GraphQLResponse<T>> subscribe(GraphQLRequest<T> graphQlRequest)
        Subscribe to mutation events that occur on a GraphQL endpoint. This, combined with subscribe(String, GraphQLRequest) are the most flexible subscription methods available, as they allow specification of a raw GraphQLRequest. This method assumes that the `amplifyconfiguration.json` contains a single GraphQL API, configured during the call to RxAmplify.configure(Context). If not, this method emits an ApiException via the returned Observable's error callback.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of object for which notifications will be dispatched
        Parameters:
        graphQlRequest - A raw GraphQL subscription request
        Returns:
        An Observable which emits 0..n GraphQLResponses when mutations occur for objects of the requested type. The stream of responses may terminate at any point with failure, emitted via the Observable's error callback. When the subscription terminates gracefully, the Observable's completion callback will be invoked. Each GraphQLResponse may itself contain errors, communicated from the endpoint. These can be inspected with GraphQLResponse.hasErrors() and GraphQLResponse.getErrors(). The network operation does not begin until the first Observable is subscribed. The subscription may be terminated at any time by invoking Disposable#dispose() on the Observable subscription. If no other Observable subscriptions exist for the object class and subscription type, the GraphQL network subscription will be closed.

      • subscribe

        <R> RxOperations.RxSubscriptionOperation<GraphQLResponse<R>> subscribe(java.lang.String apiName,
                                                                       GraphQLRequest<R> graphQlRequest)
        Subscribe to mutation events that occur on a GraphQL endpoint. This, combined with subscribe(GraphQLRequest) are the most flexible subscription methods available, as they allow specification of a raw GraphQLRequest.
        Type Parameters:
        R - The type of object for which notifications will be dispatched
        Parameters:
        apiName - The name of any GraphQL endpoint for which a configuration exists in the `amplifyconfiguration.json` that was used during the call to RxAmplify.configure(Context).
        graphQlRequest - A raw GraphQL subscription request
        Returns:
        An Observable which emits 0..n GraphQLResponses when mutations occur for objects of the requested type. The stream of responses may terminate at any point with failure, emitted via the Observable's error callback. When the subscription terminates gracefully, the Observable's completion callback will be invoked. Each GraphQLResponse may itself contain errors, communicated from the endpoint. These can be inspected with GraphQLResponse.hasErrors() and GraphQLResponse.getErrors(). The network operation does not begin until the first Observable is subscribed. The subscription may be terminated at any time by invoking Disposable#dispose() on the Observable subscription. If no other Observable subscriptions exist for the object class and subscription type, the GraphQL network subscription will be closed.
